title: Drawing, "Ulysses and Penelope Embracing Each other", 1800–20
title_raw: Ulysses and Penelope Embracing Each other
medium: Pen and brown ink over traces of graphite and black chalk on cream laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed: ulise gode della sua penelope.
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Ulysses and Penelope shown seated upon thrown. Cupid flying away. On Verso: framed lozenge gem at center. Shown laterally, scroll palmettes and above and below blossoms.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Ulysses and Penelope Embracing Each other", 1800–20. Pen and brown ink over traces of graphite and black chalk on cream laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-3324.
